title: ODE Modeling for C. difficile Transmission
position: Research Assistant, Polymath Jr REU Summer Program
bullets: Developed and analyzed ODE-based mathematical models to study community transmission of C. difficile.
Collaborated with a team to identify optimal intervention strategies for controlling C. difficile spread in communities.
Implemented simulations in MATLAB and R to evaluate disease dynamics and mitigation strategies.

title: MNAR-Aware Multi-Modal Rating Prediction
position: Independent Researcher, Emory University (Supervised by Dr. Ruoxuan Xiong)
bullets: Incorporated missing-not-at-random (MNAR) handling by encoding four distinct review-absence patterns (text-only, image-only, both, neither) and learning pattern-specific modality weights and bias corrections.
Developed a conservative composite loss that blends weighted MSE with pairwise ranking loss, assigning differential penalties per missing pattern to mitigate MNAR-induced bias.

Quantified systematic prediction offsets for each absence pattern on the validation set and applied these per-pattern rectifiers at test time, adaptively calibrating outputs to boost RMSE/MAE and NDCG performance.

title: Multimodal Causal Learning under Missing Clinical Data
position: Independent Researcher, Emory University (Supervised by Dr. Ruoxuan Xiong)
bullets: Designed a causal representation learning framework that accounts for real-world MNAR patterns in clinical data, enabling robust modeling even when key modalities (e.g., clinical notes) are absent.

Built a modality-aware fusion module, representation balancing mechanism, and a bias rectifier that jointly capture patient health status, missingness patterns, and correct residual outcome prediction biases across subgroups.

Achieved substantial gains over strong baselines on the MIMIC-IV dataset, improving readmission AUC by +16.8% and ICU prediction APR by +10.2%, particularly enhancing generalization across missingness subgroups.
Led the research as first author, from conceptualization to empirical validation; submitted to EMNLP 2025 and currently under review.

title: Collective Action & Research for Equity (CARE) Lab Research Assistant
bullets: Analyzed nearly 1,000 user data points and developed an interactive dashboard for MakerGhat using JavaScript, Python, and HTML.
Maintained a WhatsApp Education Bot via Python and Twilio for MakerGhat, enabling 15,000+ teachers to document lesson plans, impacting 600,000+ students and 10,000+ projects.

title: Research on Transformer-Based Sentiment Analysis
position: Independent Researcher, Independent Research in NLP
bullets: Developed a novel Gated Dynamic Local-Global Attention (GDLGA) model that integrates BERT-based global features with local attention via sliding windows for short-text sentiment analysis.
Achieved state-of-the-art performance on the Sentiment140 dataset, surpassing transformer baselines with an F1 score of 87.49% and AUC of 0.9484.
Conducted extensive ablation studies to validate the contributions of local attention, global attention, and gated fusion mechanisms in enhancing classification stability and interpretability.
Seepre-print for full results and model details.

title: Game-Theoretic Analysis of Autonomous Taxis & Labor Market Dynamics
position: Independent Researcher, Independent Research in Game Theory
bullets: Developed a hierarchical dynamic game-theoretic model to examine strategic interactions among governments, enterprises, and workers in autonomous taxi adoption, integrating loss aversion and risk perception.

Conducted numerical simulations and sensitivity analyses using MATLAB and Python, identifying equilibrium conditions where moderate subsidies and regulations optimize innovation and employment stability.
Formulated evidence-based policy recommendations advocating phased regulatory interventions and skill transition programs for socially sustainable integration.
Seepre-print for full results and model details.

title: Insomnia & Food Safety Event Detection via Domain-Aware Transformers
position: Independent Researcher, Emory University (Supervised by Dr. Azra Ismail)
bullets: Developed domain-adapted NLP pipelines for insomnia detection from clinical notes and food safety event extraction from FDA press releases.
Designed transformer-based classifiers (RoBERTa, ClinicalBERT) with GPT-4–driven data augmentation, class balancing, and ensemble inference to improve robustness under real-world noise.
Achieved first place in Task 5 Subtask 1 of the SMM4H-HeaRD 2025 shared task with a macro-F1 score of 0.958.
Seepre-print for full results and model details.

title: CO2 Emissions Forecasting
position: Team Leader & Research Assistant, AI Data Lab, Emory Office of Sustainability Initiatives
bullets: Built an ensemble deep learning pipeline predicting vehicle CO₂ emissions with R² > 0.99 using Canadian datasets and SHAP for explainability.
Integrated DNN, XGBoost, and Random Forest models to uncover key emission drivers for 7,300+ vehicles.
Applied SHAP to validate model decisions and generate sustainable transportation insights.
Seeposter for full results and model details.

title: Spectral Graph Theory Research
position: Research Assistant, Emory University Department of Mathematics
bullets: Investigated spectral properties of sparse matrices and their applications in clustering large-scale data, enhancing algorithmic efficiency and stability via spectral decomposition and random walk methods.
